title: Summary of Vladimir's rework
body:
passive: literally unchanged
Q: 1st+2nd Q is trash deals no damage, heals for nothing. 3rd Q heals 50% less on minions, heals for nothing until you're low, and can be avoided by not letting vladimir using his 3rd Q on you.
W: long cooldown spell, that now deals less damage, only good if you want to escape/dodge a spell
E: no longer hits you behind creeps, no longer increases sustain, costs a % of hp unlike before, needs to charge it to make damage, cooldown was increased to 11 sec or more in early game

trash base stats, trash base ms that makes melee able to hit him hard

spellvamp removed, broken 800 gold gravious wound introduced

and you still hear about "toxic laning phase vladimir" , 

what do you i say to those people? 
git gud

It's a lot like Olaf. In competitive, teams used to build comps around Olaf and Olaf would go fucking nuts. But in solo queue, the guy never had anything above a 46% winrate because his kit on it's own is selfish as fuck. Vlad's kit is less selfish but it's the same principle. Vlad on his own can't do much but Vlad with a team that allows him to excel, he's fucking stupid. 

I don't pretend to know the right answer here but it's also not okay when he's basically 1v5ing in competitive play.

eh, vlad isn't 1v5ing anyone in competition, at least in the games i looked at

care to show me an example?

The rework makes him significantly more interesting to play, but I _absolutely loathe_ his kit because he was doing terribly outside of the LCS even before this last patch, but now his winrate is even below 45%.

IMO, it's total horse shit that my main of 2.5 years has been nerfed into the fucking ground because there are 25 Korean guys who abuse him.

I haven't heard anybody really complain about Vlad's lane phase. He's way less oppressive than he used to be as a laner and has significantly more counterplay. I'm sure some have complained but in general, no I haven't seen it. 

Almost everyone knows at this point Vlad is being nerfed because what he does in competitive.

His 26% ban rate would suggest otherwise. I don't personally see why it's so high, though. I actually agree that he's kinda easy to control in lane, but I guess the consensus is that he's hard to handle? I personally haven't had a game where a Vlad had anything like a blowout effect on the game. He was just annoying with being almost impossible to finish when behind in lane (mostly top), somewhat like an Irelia with invuln instead of stun.

i want them remove the damage amplification, and only amplifies vlad's damage by 20 or 30% 

but then this would make vlad less unique
No, that would make him trash tier. {{champion:50}}  already has 20% damage amplification to himself on a basic ability.

i agree, though vlad would be able to increase his damage on 5 people.

but yeah that's bad.

Vlad still has a mobile Zhonya's. He does lack CC, but I'd hardly say he'd be non-unique if they gutted the "support" aspect of his ultimate and gave him some enhanced damage as compensation. He's looking to be more damage/tank than support in the roles he plays, anyway.

If they tune the damage amp from the ult to only apply to himself, he's going to be garbage. Even Riot said that champions who only offer damage are not healthy, which is why they reworked Ryze (again). Yes, he has the slow from his pool, but this is the last reason he would ever use it, especially in a teamfight. Yes, he has the slow from his E, but it requires full charge and is not good by itself. Everything else is just damage. Vlad's ult is the only reason for him to be picked and contribute to his team, theoretically at least.

Thing is, we're not talking about Mordekaiser here. He does have a slow and, most importantly, an invulnerable period. You take that invuln, slow, and toss on a slow/tossup ulti (which does have damage amp... hmm.), suddenly you have one of the most consistently unbalanceable champions, Fizz.

Also, I'd think his passive accounts for at least some uniqueness in his kit, as well.

He worked in Los because of teamwork and the fights can be more extended.

Vlad can't do anything on his own. He can't even keep people in range to proc his slow because it slows him.

His rework did nothing to help him and just added an immense amount of counterplay to an already bad champion.

I'm just saying, I have seen Lee Sins who display skill do wonderful things. Meanwhile, every time I see a Lissandra, she underpreforms. Whether I am murdering her down in top or mid, or when I am trying to back her up.

Lissandra also forces her lane opponent to take cleanse, keeping them from following on her TP ganks.
She also has pretty good burst and cc.

Riot hates seeing sustain be meta because it discourages flashy plays in lane. Coupled with the fact that Riot is still puzzled that AoE damage amp is good in pro play, plus they're nerfing all the wrong things all the time.

Vlad is now slow, clunky, and boring. Q is a snore fest most of the time. Requiring it to be the third one to not be boring. But having the enemy rarely come up to you when it is up. And E having to be charged + slowing you while it is charging and being blocked is obnoxious. Oh look I am slowed, oh look I am slowed. Hey guys, more being slow. *Has a nap*. I liked Vlad when he just came out. And spells cost HP but they hurt people. His ult was actually useful for blowing people up. Not just letting others hurt them. And all his skills were fast.  He also had a way longer range...though he was somewhat too strong.

I do not give a damn about helping my team mates. I liked him because I didn't have to rely on them for anything. I could do the jobs of tank, damage, healer, assassin etc for myself. Though not as good as any of those roles in a team setting. I could do them enough for the sake of only protecting myself and killing my targets. Though they have been making that harder year over year...with their attempts to push for team work...which is why I have barely played Summoners Rift in a couple to a few years. I preferred seasons 1 and 2 when I could sit in my lane, destroy them, ignore the other lanes for thirty minutes, then carry no matter how badly the other lanes did.

And yes grievous wounds...With the amount of games that people buy Morello even while not facing a champion who uses healing skills...they might as well just make Grievous Wounds permanently applied by all mages when a character is below 40% (or w.e it is) hp. Not to mention how cheap the AD version even is.

Pretty much my thoughts as well; he's not as remotely fun to play anymore because he feels like he counters himself. If riot wants to force this counterplay mentality, then they should be applying it to marksmen & assassins as well. Otherwise is another example of their favoritism & double standards.
I feel like his rework was completely unnecessary. They were already removing spell vamp, least they could have done was waited to see how it affected him before they gutted him.

>800g grievous wounds introduced

Hasn't that item been around since season 4?

It used to be an 8 second GW to target active, only gave lifesteal and crit, and cost ~50% more. It also didn't build into anything.

Then it cost 1900, gained 25 AD, 5% more crit, lost the lifesteal, applied GW for 1.5 seconds on-hit.

___________

Effectively, they lowered the cost by 1100, doubled the passive effect duration, while it lost 10 AD and 20% crit (about 1150 g worth total), and 10% healing reduction.
calling's problem was that it had no upgrade in late game (mostly).

Pretty much. 

The original could have been a great item if lifesteal and crit worked similarly to DotA.

Have you taken a peek at Vladimir's winrate? Last patch it was 45-46% and now it's around 43-44-ish. His winrate before this round of nerfs was absolutely abysmal but this is total horse shit.

Very telling that he was still broken in the right hands despite that 45-46% winrate. Means he should be in a good spot now, right? Low-Midrange casters are hard to pull off anyway, their winrates will always be below average if they're balanced.

Christ. Just because something is broken when the pros are playing doesn't mean it's broken elsewhere. The issue is that Riot has the professionals playing with the exact same balance as the rest of us, which means certain champions that are trash elsewhere are able to dumpster because the professionals play on an entirely different level and have infinitely more teamwork and coordination.

There's an enormous difference between balance and 25 Korean guys butchering with a champion. Balance means that a champion wins around half of games they're in across the board, not this disgusting bipolar situation where 99.999% of players have a winrate of 44% or so compared to pros that have a winrate of like 70% or some bullshit with him.

That's not balance: that's shitty design right there. While Vladimir's rework made him more fun to play against, he's damn near impossible to balance now because if you make him balanced at regular play, he'll be ridiculous in pro play.

How in the actual fuck can you say 44% is just "below average"? It's one of the worst winrates of any champion that isn't new and he has the worst winrate in the entire game right now and Yorick was just released. That isn't below average, it's pathetic.

50% winrate across the board is improbable as heck. 

And I'm sorry but you're basically saying that people who have room to improve should be just as successful at a champion as the people who've come close to perfection. What? Vlad was and is a lane bully and someone who chunked and kited your entire team in teamfights. So pro-level coordination was not the primary factor in his success, his high skill cap was.
